description: Arithmetic operations, order of operations, place value, rounding, and working backwards through calculations.

concepts.name: Place Value
concepts.description: Understanding digit values in large numbers, comparing place values
common_misconceptions: Not understanding relative value of digits
question_patterns: In the number {N}, how many times larger is digit {X} than digit {Y}?
What is the value of the digit {X} in {N}?
example_stems: In 30,060, how many times larger is the value of 3 than 6?
What is the value of the 7 in 47,382?

concepts.name: Order of Operations
concepts.description: Applying BODMAS/BIDMAS rules to multi-operation expressions
common_misconceptions: Calculating left to right ignoring order
question_patterns: Which number sentence shows this information?
example_stems: When 117 chocolates are shared between 14 people, each gets 8 with 5 left over. Which equation shows this?

concepts.name: Rounding Numbers
concepts.description: Rounding to nearest 10, 100, 1000, or specified place value
common_misconceptions: Rounding down when digit is 5 (should round up)
Confusion with multiple rounding to different places
question_patterns: What is the difference when {N} is rounded two different ways?
example_stems: Alinta rounds 4,850,000 to nearest million. Tau rounds to nearest hundred thousand. What is the difference?

concepts.name: Working Backwards
concepts.description: Finding starting values by reversing operations in word problems
common_misconceptions: Applying operations in wrong order when reversing
question_patterns: Alan started with {X}. After these actions, he had {Y}. What was the original?
Working backwards from the result, find the starting value.
example_stems: Alan had $10. He gave some to Kiana, half of remainder to Jason. Jason gave half to Lenny who got $1.60. How much did Alan give Kiana?
After doubling and adding 5, the result is 23. What was the starting number?

concepts.name: Multiplication and Division
concepts.description: Multi-digit multiplication and division, including with large numbers
common_misconceptions: Forgetting zeros when multiplying by 10, 100, etc.
question_patterns: Multiply the smallest {X}-digit number by the largest {Y}-digit number.
example_stems: Nicola multiplies the smallest 4-digit number by the largest 2-digit number. What is the answer?

concepts.name: Magic Squares and Number Puzzles
concepts.description: Completing magic squares where rows, columns, and diagonals sum to same total
common_misconceptions: Forgetting diagonals must also sum correctly
Arithmetic errors in finding missing values
question_patterns: In this magic square, what is the missing number?
Complete the magic square where each row/column/diagonal sums to {N}.
example_stems: In a magic square with top row 20, 15, 16 and 18 in bottom left, find the missing bottom right number.
What number completes this magic square?
